reviewText: The robot repairman episode is the new favorite in our house.  Great music, and definitely a fun movie for my kids (1 and 3).  My son (3) asks to watch it every morning.  The other two episodes on this disc are not that great, which is the reason for my 4-star review.  Both episodes only have Tyrone, Pablo and Uniqua (missing Austin and Tasha) and they seem to fall flat.  Overall though, definitely  a good buy for Backyardigans fans!**Robot Repairman:  Austin is a robot repairman in Mega City.  Together with Uniqua, Tasha and Tyrone, he must figure out why all the robots are suddenly malfunctioning.  Set to disco music!** Catch that Train:  Uniqua is a train conductor moving the Czar to his winter home.  She and Pablo must catch the runaway train before it's too late.** 50 Foot Worman:  Pablo and Uniqua are scientists at a university.  Uniqua is studying wormen, and Pablo is working on a growth formula.  When the two mix, they team up with Tyrone to shrink the worman.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lots of music and fun in each segment. Makes our granddaughter very happy. A couple of animated segments and a piece using live actors with lots of singing and dancing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Three episodes: "Robot Rampage, Catch that Train!, and Attack of the 50 Foot Worman."No extras, but if you like robots, then this is a must.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have a four year old and a two year old and they both love The Backyardigans.  It is a great show for preschoolers.  I wish they would go on "tour" again, they were wonderful in concert for the Mighty Knights.

reviewText: My boys first saw this movie long ago, but still have a fondness for it.IT remains in our DVD player when the urge to watch arises.

reviewText: A hit with the kids (3 and 5). The songs on Robot Rampage are great, particularly Evil Pablo's "I get what I want." And the kids love the fact that Pablo says "I'm pooped" throughout "Catch That Train." Another great collection of episodes from The Backyardigans! Episodes: Robot Rampage (Robot Repairman), Catch That Train, Attack of the 50 Ft Worman.
Title: N/A

reviewText: My 3 year old and 6 year old grandsons love this DVD.  They love the music and the dancing.  I like the way it keeps their attention and everything is presented in a positive way.
